word: Brethren and sisters, now is our time to make haste to do something. Will you now give of your means to advance the work in the South? If you have in your possession houses and lands that you do not need, will you sell them, and invest the means thus obtained in more firmly establishing the various lines of work that have been begun in the Southern field?--Letter 72, 1902, pp. 3, 4, 8. ("To Our Churches in America," typed May 18, 1902.)
